IncidentSuppNarrative.NarrativeText:
NARRATIVE:
     On February 16, 2023, I, M/TPR. Hegedus #4721 was assigned an ATF referral case for a follow-up investigation in reference to a Maryland resident purchasing a firearm that is on the Maryland banned list from a Virginia FFL dealer. 

     On February 8th, 2023, an ATF compliance inspection was conducted on the Federal Firearms Licensee, Casey Gene Traxler dba Tier 1 Operations, #1-54-23991, located at 15600 Malvosin Place, Leesburg, VA 20176.  During the compliance inspection and review of the licensee’s Forms 4473, it was discovered that a banned rifle was transferred to a Maryland resident. The licensee, Casey Traxler, transferred the rifle to a Maryland resident (individual purchaser) during the inspection period of February 8th, 2022 through February 8th, 2023.  The Form 4473 information including the firearm specifics are below:

     Purchaser: Cristian Enrique Sanchez, DOB:  02/19/2003, Transaction Date:  12/05/2022, Manufacturer: Palmetto State Armory, Type: Rifle, Caliber: 7.62x39, Model: AK47 GF3, S/N: AKB087039.  Cristian was found not to be prohibited at this time for non-regulated firearms.  Cristian is prohibited from regulated firearms only do to age (under 21yoa).

     During the course of the investigation, it was learned that Cristian was being held at the Frederick County, MD Detention Center since February 05, 2023 on an unrelated incident.

     On February 22, 2023 at approximately 1020 hours, CPL. Jackson #1798 and I attempted to make contact with the residents of 824 Geronimo Drive, Frederick, MD 21701 in reference to them having any knowledge of the banned firearm (AK).  Cristian’s father, Enrique Sanchez and brother, Juan Sanchez invited us into the residence.  I identified ourselves and the reason for contacting them.  Enrique stated that Cristian is currently at the local detention center and does not know anything about the rifle.  Juan also advised he has not seen or know anything about Cristian’s rifle.

     We then made contact with Cristian at the Frederick County Detention Center on February 22, 2023 at approximately 1054 hours.  I identified ourselves and the reason for contacting him.  I explained to Cristian that I would have to take possession of the rifle since the Virginia FFL sold/transferred him a banned weapon.  Cristian advised the rifle is in the closet in his bedroom and his father would able to surrender it to us.

     On February 22, 2023 at approximately 1135 hours, CPL. Jackson and I made contact with Enrique at his residence located at 824 Geronimo Drive, Frederick, MD 21701.  We advised Enrique Cristian had stated the rifle was in his bedroom closet and he gave permission for him to surrender the firearm to us.  Enrique invited us into his residence.  Enrique signed and received a copy of the MSP Form 78 (Consent to Search and Seize), however; he was unable to locate the firearm.  Enrique invited us back to the bedroom in an attempt to locate the rifle with negative results.  Enrique then spoke to his other son, Juan who was located in the other bedroom.  Enrique and Juan were conversing in Spanish.  Enrique then advised us he had to contact his sister-in-law and or Cristian’s cousin.  After Enrique spoke to his sister-in-law he stated the rifle is supposed to be at his sister-in-laws residence and we can follow him to her residence.

     On February 22, 2023 at approximately 1200 hours we arrived at 8207 Buchanan, Walkersville, MD 21793.  Enrique knocked on the door and we were invited in. 

     On February 22, 2023 at approximately 1205 hours, I seized the below listed firearm.  The firearm was placed on a MSP Form 67 (Chain of Custody).  Leonor Hernandez-Perez (homeowner) signed and received copies of the MSP Form 67 and MSP Form 78 (Consent to Search and Seize).
 
1.  Palmetto State Armory (PSA), Model PSAK-47 (GF3), 7.62x39 caliber rifle, SN: AKB087039

     I then responded to the Hagerstown MSP Barrack where the firearm was processed and packaged in accordance with MSP policy and procedures.  The firearm was captured on Property Record No. P-337031.

     The firearm had negative results through NCIC.

     Due to the above facts, I request this case be administratively closed.
